result.execSummary:
The defendant Feliks Rozental was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars or taverns or liquor stores
--to submit a DNA sample
--no contact with Shannon Rozental except as necessary to facilitate custody and placement of their children and in accord with any order in 15FA396
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no acts or threats of violence or any other insulting or demeaning behavior directed towards Shannon Rozental

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 10:27am [mo]
Defendant Feliks Rozental in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Hall submits a Victim Impact Statement
--Atty. Huebner submits treatment documentation

Statement made by Mr. Rozental

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on     12/7/15 at  7:00   pm.
--Huber is subject to the Sheriff's rules, but the Court does authorize for work, child care and family care (Defendant's grandmother), for treatment purposes, including the Domestic Violence Counseling. 
---Mr. Rozental is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--complete a certified batterer intervention program
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars or taverns or liquor stores
--to submit a DNA sample
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--no contact with Shannon Rozental except as necessary to facilitate custody and placement of their children and in accord with any order in 15FA396
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no acts or threats of violence or any other insulting or demeaning behavior directed towards Shannon Rozental

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:50am

Case called at 3pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Feliks Rozental in court with attorney Karl Huebner.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Huebner informs the Court that this matter should be scheduled for FSSC and Jury. 
Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for:
-  FSSC on 12/1/15 at 10:30am
-  Jury on 12/7/15 at 8:30am

[MK] case called at 11:02am. 
Defendant Feliks Rozental in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Rozental provides a new address in Milwaukee.  He verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $650 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no contact with Shannon Rozental directly; indirect contact may take place in court and through an attorney. 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores.  
recess 11:07am.


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 10:00am  (2)  Status Conference on 11/10/15 at 2:30pm.
